data.mission: Develop an integrated theoretical-to-experimental pipeline connecting discrete-gravity microstructure (causal sets, discrete spectra) to measurable signatures in analogue platforms and astrophysical probes. Produce a prioritized set of concrete measurement protocols for correlators and entanglement diagnostics, a plan for controlled numerical/analytical simulations quantifying finite-size and dispersive systematics, and a statistical-inference strategy to translate measured data into constraints on discrete-structure parameters.

Produce a focused project plan and the first structured draft outline for a balanced cross-program review and living wiki centered on renormalization-group/coarse-graining as the unifying language. The deliverable should (a) map each programâ€™s RG/coarse-graining methods, assumptions, and characteristic scales, (b) identify common technical tools and notation and propose a minimal shared glossary/translation guide, and (c) provide a contributor recruitment and governance template to ensure cross-program balance and an updating workflow for a living document.
Evaluate divergence among top hypotheses for cycle 76
